page.title: 02The Southampton Ice Rink
page.content: The Southampton Ice Rink, built in 1931, was land mined in the Second World War. It was reopened in September 1952. There was a Beginners' Rink that was turned into a buffet while a new ice-pad was put down. Beginners found it was easier to skate on the main rink, holding onto the barrier. So the Beginners' Rink is now closed for good. It takes three days to lay the ice from scratch. First the ice-pad must be cooled down sufficiently to freeze the water, which is then put on in thin coats. It takes thousands of gallons to get a thickness of one inch.
